title.narrative: Malawi - Projet Santé Rurale III (RHCP III)
Malawi - Rural Health Care Project III (RHCP III)

description.narrative: The objective of the project was to increase access to health care as well as enhance quality of care for rural communities.

The present intervention relates to the Rural Health Care Project III. It’s designed to increase and strengthen Health infrastructures in the five districts of Mchinji, Nkhotakota, Phalombe, Ntchisi and Salima. The project comprises four (04) components which are: I) Improved Primary Care Infrastructure; II) Human Resources Development and Management Capacity Building; III) Control of the Spread of HIV/AIDS; and IV) Project Management.

The primary beneficiaries of the project are the rural population in the five districts of Mchinji, Nkhotakota, Phalombe, Ntchisi and Salima. Secondary beneficiaries include the Planning Department of the MOHP, the District Health Offices as well as the laboratories of 4 district hospitals and the Lilongwe Central Hospital and their respective staff.
Health - policy, planning and administration
